title: How to Make Chinese Tomato and Egg Soup

steps.headline: Put three teaspoons of vegetable oil into a pot.
Cut the three tomatoes into slices.
steps.description: Cut the tomatoes into a series of small half slices. See the size as shown in the photo.

steps.headline: Stir-fry the tomatoes until they become soft enough to mash.
steps.description: Smash them with a potato masher until they become liquefied. You could also a food processor, but don't process the tomatoes too much.

steps.headline: Beat 2 eggs with a fork.
steps.description: Add them to the liquefied tomatoes.

steps.headline: Add some water to the pot until it just covers the liquefied tomato and egg mixture.
steps.description: Heat until the water comes to a slow boil.

steps.headline: Cut the 4 green onions into slices and put them into the pot.
steps.description: Cook for a couple more minutes on a medium heat before emptying into a bowl. Your soup is ready––enjoy!

text: Put three teaspoons of vegetable oil into a pot.  Cut the three tomatoes into slices. Cut the tomatoes into a series of small half slices. See the size as shown in the photo. Stir-fry the tomatoes until they become soft enough to mash. Smash them with a potato masher until they become liquefied. You could also a food processor, but don't process the tomatoes too much. Beat 2 eggs with a fork. Add them to the liquefied tomatoes. Add some water to the pot until it just covers the liquefied tomato and egg mixture. Heat until the water comes to a slow boil. Cut the 4 green onions into slices and put them into the pot. Cook for a couple more minutes on a medium heat before emptying into a bowl. Your soup is ready––enjoy!
